מחיר ההפגנות: הונג קונג נקלעה למיתון - הראשון מזה עשור
חודשים של מחאה אנטי סינית גובים מחיר, וכלכלת הונג קונג התכווצה ב-3.2% ברבעון שעבר - רבעון שני ברציפות של ירידה; החשש הוא שהמגמה תימשך אל תוך 2020
02 Nov 2019 by שירות כלכליסט
חודשים של מחאות אנטי סיניות בהונג קונג גררו סגירת חנויות, שיתוק בתחבורה הציבורית וירידה בתיירות, ולפי סקירה ב-CNN קיים חשש כבד לכלכלת המושבה הבריטית לשעבר.
לפי נתונים שפורסמו שלשום (ה') רשמה כלכלת הונג קונג התכווצות של 3.2% ברבעון השלישי, זאת בהשוואה לרבעון השני. זאת לעומת ירידה של 0.5% ברבעון השני, ונתון גרוע בהרבה מהתחזיות. מדובר במיתון הראשון שם מזה עשור, וכלכלנים חוששים כי הוא יימשך אל תוך השנה הבאה. בהשוואה לרבעון השלישי בשנה שעברה מדובר בירידה של 2.9%.


מחאה בהונג קונג צילום: Reuters

לדברי המושלת קארי לאם, "בכנות, אין מקום לאופטימיות". היא אמרה את הדברים באירוע עסקי.
המשבר הכלכלי נגרם בשל השפעת מלחמת הסחר בין סין וארה"ב, מההאטה בסין השולטת בהונג קונג וכאמור המחאה הבלתי פוסקת.
דובר מטעם הממשלה אמר שכלכלת הונג קונג רשמה צמיחה מאז השנה שעברה אך עתה מדובר ב"הידרדרות פתאומית כתוצאה מההשפעה החמורה של תקריות חברתיות מקומיות".
אנליסטים צופים בעקבות הנתונים כי הונג קונג תחמיץ את יעד הצמיחה שלה השנה - 0%-1%.
לדברי איריס פאניג, כלכלנית ב-ING, "סביר להניח שהצמיחה תהפוך שלילית ב-2019 וגם ב-2020. אינני רואה כיצד המחאות יסתיימו". להערכתה, הצמיחה בהונג קונג תרשום ירידה של 0.1%, ועלייה מזערית של 0.6% בשנה הבאה.
אחד הנזקים המשמעותיים הוא לתיירות, ונרשמה ירידה של 37% במספר התיירים ברבעון שעבר. למרות הנזקים הכבדים לכלכלה הריאלית, מדד האנג סנג רשם עלייה של 4% מראשית השנה, והמשקיעים עדיין רואים בהונג קונג שער חשוב לאסיה.

Emmanuelle Léonard, the soul of a documentary maker
02 Nov 2019 by Jérôme Delgado
For twenty years and more - since the exhibition of "young people" Of passion and passion (Museum of Contemporary Art of Montreal, 1997) - Emmanuelle Léonard takes its place among the essential. With enigmatic images and revealing testimonies. "I'm lucky, I've always been able to do projects. Afterwards, I had difficult passages, like everyone else, "admits this ex-member of the center Clark rebellious who has exhibited in the biennials and triennales, at events of Quebec art abroad and, here, everywhere where does it count?
Between document and essay, his practice, initially only photographic, then integrating archives and videos, plunges us into inaccessible spheres. At the beginning of 2019, the group exhibition L'attente, at the UQAM Gallery, included Le camion et la grâce, a video produced by social workers. The same broadcaster rounds off the year by reserving all its rooms to the discreet and intrusive look of Emmanuelle Léonard. The Deployment Expo is not a retrospective. It offers only new, works made in the Far North - at -60 degrees Celsius at times - and in a desert region of Colombia. The main corpus was taken from Nunavut as part of the Canadian Forces Arts Program. We will come back to this in the weeks to come.

Born in the dark room

Photographer, Emmanuelle Léonard claims to have always been. At least since the sting she had as a teenager while attending the Cultural Activities Department of the University of Montreal. It was in the dark rooms of a discreet pavilion on Boulevard Edouard-Montpetit that his passion was born. "The photo was life-saving," she says. I was anxious, rather bum. When I entered the dark room, I did not go out. "
The advent of digital photography ended up removing it from the lab. But seeing her studio in Villeray, lined with Deployment images, she did not lose fiber. Behind a canvas, his new dark room: a huge printer. "I like to print and here I can have coffee at the same time," she says. In the light. I would have been tired of being in a dark room, surrounded by acids. "
This fascination to do it, for the making of images, has developed over the years by a quest still ongoing on the why and the "by-whom" of an image. Emmanuelle Léonard believes that the image tells, documents, reveals, even to fall short of the theories that the photography is only staged.
"I believe in the documentary. Yes, the image is built, okay, okay, she exclaims. Still, the police archives on which I worked [the series Homicide, detained vs. detained, 2010] also serve us, hug! They tell about life in prison, the cramped, the dish soap ... "
The authority, the institution, the power go through the practice of this politician's daughter - the former PQ minister Jacques Léonard. Yesterday the figure of the policeman, today that of the military. The National Assembly, justice, science, the Church have been at the center of his questions. "I come from an environment where the relationship to institutions is anything but cynical. They are important, "she reasoned, without wanting to detail her family life.
It is not the criticism that drives Emmanuelle Léonard to scrutinize the interior of hierarchical worlds, but curiosity. She is thirsty to see what is hidden from view. She has often hit the walls, trying to reach the inaccessible. She used a thousand tricks to, for example, enter the world of work and thus, to In the eye of the worker (2001), a series of photos taken by workers and other professionals.

The stratagems varied from one case to another and allowed the artist to point the surveillance in our societies, including in the public space. Emmanuelle Léonard wandered in Mexico, camera under a hat - Guardia, resguárdeme, 2005. She also took advantage of a demonstration to detect the human behind the policeman on duty - The citizens, demonstration, March 15, 2009. "Even when you have a role in a hierarchy, life deflects you. Like this guy who's hitting a girl, a security guard who's doing something other than watching. There is always a little sand, everything is not smooth, "she summarizes, thinking of her images of Mexico.
The sand in the gear is a little what Emmanuelle Léonard is looking for. Or the cog in the machine, a metaphor that a soldier gave him. The artist interviewed soldiers from Valcartier in front of the camera, which gave a video taken back from his stay in the Arctic.
Her documentary approach is that, she says, of Raymond Depardon, master in the genre: "What I like is to put the eyes on the back burner. The frame is fixed and let things happen. "Put the look aside and listen" was how she followed the deployment of the Canadian army in Resolute, Nunavut. The challenge was significant, not only because of the intense cold, but also because of technical difficulties. If the military struggles to start their snowmobiles, the artist works blindly, misty glasses, unable to focus.
"They told me about the distance, the beauty of the sky, the cold. The territory is big, but their movement is tiny. [The work] challenges this work, but also the [human] presence in the Arctic, "says the artist.
The deployment of Emmanuel Leonard. At the UQAM Gallery, until January 25th.
